cjdelisle - (14:14): https://encrypted.google.com/search?q=xwiki+irc+logs  
cjdelisle - (14:15): Second result is dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/get/IRC/WebHome  mime type is not html.  
sdumitriu - (14:19): It uses /get/ instead of /view/, so it's normal  
sdumitriu - (14:19): But how did it get to the /get/ action?  
sdumitriu - (14:20): Does it parse JS? The only place is this JS line:  
sdumitriu - (14:20): window.docgeturl = "/xwiki/bin/get/IRC/WebHome";  
cjdelisle - (14:20): Isn't there some header you can put that makes google redirect?  
sdumitriu - (14:21): Yes  
sdumitriu - (14:21): Something with canonical  
sdumitriu - (14:22): <link rel="canonical" href="http://www.example.com/product.php?item=swedish-fish" />  
cjdelisle - (14:23): yes, reading the same page...  
sdumitriu - (14:23): But that doesn't help, since the /get/ result does not have a <head> section  
sdumitriu - (14:24): And it's not even HTML  
cjdelisle - (14:24): hmm. robots.txt?  
sdumitriu - (14:26): This might help; http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.14  
cjdelisle - (14:26): we could put <link rel="canonical" href="$doc.getExternalUrl()" /> in the html header vm. That would help with ?code ?comments etc.  
sdumitriu - (14:27): Yes  
cjdelisle - (14:28): I guess that's something for the people with ssh keys to do since it's on disk.  
cjdelisle - (15:15): hey, I like XWIKI-3949
